alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 17 at 9:46PM HST until February 18 at 1:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County * Until 100 AM HST. * At 946 PM HST, radar showed heavy showers repeatedly forming over the slopes of the Kau and Puna Districts, with rainfall rates between 1 and 2 inches per hour leading to significant runoff. In the Kau District, road closures include Highway 11 at Kawa Flats, Wood Valley Road, and Kaalaiki Road. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Wood Valley, Volcano, Pahala, Glenwood, Punaluu Beach, Kawa Flats, Mountain View, Naalehu, Hawaiian Acres, Fern Forest, Eden Roc, Fern Acres, Waiohinu, and Kurtistown. This warning may need to be extended beyond 100 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
